meanings.definition: Cravening (verb): to have a strong desire or craving for something
meanings.sent1: She was cravening a piece of chocolate cake after dinner.
meanings.sent2: He cravened adventure and excitement in his life.
meanings.sent3: The cat was cravening for attention, meowing loudly at the door.
meanings.sent4: His heart was cravening for the freedom of the open road.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking in the oven had her cravening for a warm slice.

meanings.definition: Cravening (adjective): showing a lack of courage or cowardice
meanings.sent1: The cravening soldier fled from the battlefield in fear.
meanings.sent2: Her cravening behavior in the face of danger disappointed her friends.
meanings.sent3: The cravening puppy hid behind its owner when it heard thunder.
meanings.sent4: The cravening villain cowered in the shadows, afraid of being caught.
meanings.sent5: His cravening nature was evident in his refusal to stand up for what was right.
